## client package

## Classes

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [APIResponseError](./client.apiresponseerror.md) | A response from the API indicating a problem. Use the <code>code</code> property to handle various kinds of errors. All its possible values are in <code>APIErrorCode</code>. |
|  [Client](./client.client.md) |  |
|  [RequestTimeoutError](./client.requesttimeouterror.md) | Error thrown by the client if a request times out. |
|  [UnknownHTTPResponseError](./client.unknownhttpresponseerror.md) | Error thrown if an API call responds with an unknown error code, or does not respond with a property-formatted error. |

## Enumerations

|  Enumeration | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [APIErrorCode](./client.apierrorcode.md) | Error codes returned in responses from the API. |
|  [ClientErrorCode](./client.clienterrorcode.md) | Error codes generated for client errors. |
|  [LogLevel](./client.loglevel.md) |  |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [collectPaginatedAPI(listFn, firstPageArgs)](./client.collectpaginatedapi.md) | <p>Collect all of the results of paginating an API into an in-memory array.</p><p>Example (given a notion Client called <code>notion</code>):</p>
```
const blocks = await collectPaginatedAPI(notion.blocks.children.list, {
  block_id: parentBlockId,
})
// Do something with blocks.
```
 |
|  [isFullBlock(response)](./client.isfullblock.md) |  |
|  [isFullComment(response)](./client.isfullcomment.md) |  |
|  [isFullDatabase(response)](./client.isfulldatabase.md) |  |
|  [isFullPage(response)](./client.isfullpage.md) |  |
|  [isFullPageOrDatabase(response)](./client.isfullpageordatabase.md) |  |
|  [isFullUser(response)](./client.isfulluser.md) |  |
|  [isNotionClientError(error)](./client.isnotionclienterror.md) |  |
|  [iteratePaginatedAPI(listFn, firstPageArgs)](./client.iteratepaginatedapi.md) | <p>Returns an async iterator over the results of any paginated Notion API.</p><p>Example (given a notion Client called <code>notion</code>):</p>
```
for await (const block of iteratePaginatedAPI(notion.blocks.children.list, {
  block_id: parentBlockId,
})) {
  // Do something with block.
}
```
 |
